headline: Bacon Ranch Pasta Salad
description: This is a flavorful bacon ranch pasta salad with crispy bits of bacon that complement tomato, cheese, and ranch seasoning. Popular at any party.

video.description: Cheddar, bacon, ranch dressing mix, and mayo make a very flavorful salad.
video.name: Bacon Ranch Pasta Salad

name: Bacon Ranch Pasta Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 ounce) package uncooked tri-color rotini pasta
3 tablespoons dry ranch salad dressing mix

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; cook rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain.
Place bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook until evenly brown. Drain and chop.
Mix mayonnaise, ranch dressing mix, garlic pepper, and garlic powder together in a large bowl. Stir in milk until smooth.

Place rotini, bacon, tomato, black olives, and cheese in a bowl and toss to coat with dressing. Cover and chill at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. Toss with additional milk if the salad seems a little dry.

review.reviewBody: Delicious!!!! Made exactly as written. Used grape tomatoes quartered, and skim milk--so good! Thank you for sharing this delightful recipe!! We are adding this to our regular rotation.

I've made this several times. My daughters prefer it without tomatoes because they don't like them and my husband prefers it without olives. I usually just make it as is and tell them to pick out what they don't like. I always refrigerate and then add a little milk right before serving.
I didn't add black olives but I did add the small sweet peppers. I always follow a recipe exactly the first time and then change it up the next time as needed.
I didn't have garlic pepper so I added a 1/4 tsp black pepper and doubled the garlic powder. Came out great!
I make the following additions- chopped zucchini, celery, corn, grated cheddar cheese and chicken breast. I serve it on s bed of spinach
Wonderful crowd pleaser. I used a zesty garlic blend instead of the garlic.
This is one of my go to recipes. I make this several times a year. Do yourself a favor and add some canned chicken to the mix

Thought this was delicious! I did make a few slight changes. Since my cherry tomatoes were not edible any longer- I omitted them. I added a few slices of onion- chopped semi finely. I also used a tish more milk to start out with. I added black pepper and some onion salt as well! Yum!

Not everyone likes tomatoes, so I used a container of grape tomatoes so the juice wasn't on all of the pasta salad. DO NOT substitute Miracle Whip for the mayo, it is nasty! My quick go to for bacon is the packages of real bacon pieces, don't get the imitation, they aren't as good. I make this very often!
I made this awhile back. VERY GOOD. It was so good that family has now been asking me to make it again! Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe ??

Excellent amount of flavor and moisture. My dinner company raved about the dish. I made the pasta and vegetables and sauce separately the night before and blended them together and refrigerated just hours before serving. This helped from the pasta soaking up too much sauce as another writer pointed out as well.

This is similar to the recipe from a deli that I worked at in college, the only differences are using red bell pepper instead of tomato, and addition of green onion. I also use a full pound of pasta and bacon.
As other reviewers suggested, I added cucumber, carrot and peas, to up the veggie quotient. Very good!
We didn't like this one. Sorry, it was bland and I tried, but couldn't find a way to make it better.
I don’t have the garlic pepper so I just used pepper. Still turned out great!

This is delicious! The only thing I did different was to add chopped red onion and a couple shakes of red pepper flakes. I made this with both bacon I cooked and another time with bacon bits. If you can, I would recommend cooked bacon, it gave the salad so much more flavor!

I made this salad exactly as the recipe called for. It was delicious. Served it for company last night and everyone loved it, even one of the "picky" eaters. It had a lot of flavor and the bacon was the key. i would recommend making it the day before then letting it come up to room temperature before eating. I also added the bacon at the last minut.

I really Like the recipe, anything with bacon is pretty good. I know most people did a lot of substituting. I just omitted the olive and I made my own ranch dressing, the 1st ingredient in hidden valley ranch mix is maltodextrin and a few other chemicals, i try my best not to use packaged foods. Thank you for the recipe.
The is delicious! Always a crowd pleaser!

Very good! I used a jar of Hormel Bacon Pieces instead of cooking bacon and added 1/8 of a pound chopped hard salami from the deli. I also added 1/2 of a English cucumber, diced, and some thinly sliced red onion. Instead of just Mayo, I used 1/2 cup mayo and a 1/2 cup sour cream. I used an extra sharp yellow and sharp white large shred shredded cheese mix. It was one of the best pasta salads I have ever made! Thanks for the basic recipe, Wilemon!
I didn't add tomatoes. Instead I added some frozen mixed vegetable (thawed) it turned out great!

I loved this pasta! I never tried a cold pasta till this recipe but I did make changes. I did 1/2 of mayo and 1/2 sourcream- the full cup of mayo sounded nasty. I did use 1/2 cup of heavy cream instead of milk. I did 1/2 tspoon of garlic powder & 1/2 tspoon of pepper with a whole ranch seasoning packet! i didn't use tomatoes because I dont like tomatoes but used jalapeno and green onions with the addition of the olives! this was so delicious! but after you mix the pasta be SURE TO LET IT CHILL for atleast an hour. it makes it taste way way way better.
I made this for my Fourth of July party and it was a total hit. This will be my go to pasta salad for now on.

Almost the same as I make. I use 1/2 mayo and 1/2 ranch dressing mixed together for the dressing. I put olives and add whatever vegetables I feel like - tomatoes, green onions, radishes. This is family favorite.
Tasty although it was more than an hour to chill.

Very tasty pasta salad. I used mayo, miracle whip and sour cream to tone down the mayo flavor. I added my choice of veggies such as diced sweet pepper, broccoli, red onion... plus, as another reviewer suggested I kept a cup of the pasta water to remoisten the next day before serving. It was perfect.

Leave out olives, add celery. 
Full pack of the dressing mix. 
Could use half cream, half milk for liquid.
I made this pasta salad for a party and everyone was talking about it! It was a MAJOR hit!!!!
Overall it tastes very strongly of ranch. I don't think all the components go very well together but the tomatoes are a great addition.

This salad is easy and tastes incredible. I like to use quartered grape tomatoes instead of a big tomato. I add cubed fresh mozzarella and cooked chicken breast for extra protein to make a main dish out of it. I knew it was a win when my husband, who hates leftovers, told me not to bother cooking dinner because he’d just eat “that salad we had last night.” This makes a huge batch with my added ingredients, but the leftovers always disappear.

Great recipe; I add a medium onion. To me, pasta salad must have onion. I’ve made it several times, once I threw in some hard boiled eggs and I don’t use the tricolor pasta, any type like elbows.. This has become my new go to recipe for pasta salad.
Very good! Followed the recipe exactly and everyone loved it. Especially my 16 year old daughter. Will definitely be making again and again.

I used half the amount of Ranch seasoning the recipe called for because I didn’t buy the correct amount. The lack of Ranch seasoning could be why I found the salad to be bland. Also, next time I’m going to trim the fat off the bacon before cooking it and adding it to the salad. The moisture from the mayo made the bacon kind of mushy.
Really good. I forgot to adjust servings and had a lot of leftover. But it was really good.

I make this all the time. I skip the garlic though. I usually use whatever pasta I have on hand, macarroni, tri-colored, bowties, etc. I also throw in hard boiled eggs, corn, peas, carrots, black olives, again whatever I have on hand. Everyone loves it.
Recipe was very good. Would make again.
No changes.....delicious!!!
Very good. This was quick and easy to make!!
Easy to prepare and good to eat!

Oh my great pasta salad gods 

Probably one of the best, yet simplest pasta salad I’ve ever made!! I did add about 1/2 cup of sour cream for that cream dressing punch!! This is definitely being added to my collection
Delicious salad! Everyone enjoys it and I've never had a complaint. Have made it several times now. Definitely a keeper.
Easy and delicious! Followed the recipe exactly and we all loved it.
easy to make and always requested for Family functions
My family doesn't like tomatoes, so I left those out. Very delicious!
Best pasta to enjoy with bbq! Family loved it & wanted more!!
Made it worth a bbq dinner and the family loved it.
Made it worth a bbq dinner and the family loved it.
Made exactly as directed but left it on frig over night. Had with dinner with friends and was big hit and they wanted recipe.

This has become our new favorite salad! I've followed the recipe pretty much but use a pound of bacon and also add one 10 oz. can of white chicken meat, diced, and 3 or 4 chopped green onions - and didn't use garlic pepper. We don't have 4.25 oz. cans of black olives here, so I either use one 3.8 oz. or two 2.25 oz. cans. I think the recipe is spot-on using sharp cheddar cheese. I've become a fan of using sharp cheddar when mixed with other ingredients, but prefer mild if I eat it plain. This is a very tasty dish, and my husband loves it.
Excellent. I don't use the tomato or olives. I added in green onion, cucumber, peas and matchstick carrots. This last time I added shredded chicken. I've made it twice now and it's a big hit.
followed as written using fresh garden tomatoes and it was hit at our neighborhood potluck!
I used real bacon bits, cubes of cheese. I had a can of chopped black olives. NOT good choice. Taste was excellent... I will make it again.
Delicious. I used rotel diced tomatoes with onions and buttermilk. It was delicious .
Big hit at a recent party. The only complaint I got was to cut back on the bacon. Some thought it over powered the recipe. All in all it still is super tasty and I will make again!
I'm asked to make this all the time! So good. I do love to add green onions however, it is good as is. A recipe you don't need to fix up or mess with!
Excellent! Everyone loved it at the BBQ, asked for the recipe.
This is delicious! Needed a last minute side dish for a barbecue and just happened to have all the ingredients for this. Turned out great!

Used this for a work picnic and it was an absolute hit! Everyone LOVED it and continuously asked for the recipe. I did alter it a little by omitting the olives and adding grilled chicken. I also used ranch dressing in the place of the mayonnaise so it had a ranchier flavor. 10/10, will definitely make it again.

This was so delicious and hearty to eat. When I made it on Thursday night, it was so fully in every. bite. I've used turkey bacon and a combo of shredded/grated Parmesan cheese since I ran out of the shredded variety. It came out so good. I would love to make it again.
TURNED OUT GREAT! i love this dish so much i make it a lot for get together and family nights and they cant get enough
I don't eat Ranch dressing but in this pasta salad it was great. Will definitely make this again.
No changes made. The wife and I both liked it very much, and agreed to put it in our regular rotation. We will be making it again.
I added some imitation crab meat or left over chicken would be good too. The recipe was very tasty.
Follow the directions to the t , everyone wanted the recipe. Was very easy, went fast. Will have to double the recipe for the next time.. lots of people, big eaters. Will definitely make again
I took this to a work potluck and got many compliments. It was delicious.
Loved it, it was easy to make and ingredients were all things I had on hand. Brought it to a party and it was a hit!

This is our favorite pasta recipe. I added a little green onion and omitted the salt. The bacon and mayo have enough salt to balance out the flavour. We use the recipe from this site for our ranch mix it also has salt in it.

Made it for family visit and it went quickly. I thought it needed a bit more sauce or something to "zing" it up. Easy to make. I will make again but I always like to tweak recipes when I make them. This time I followed the recipe except no black olives (one member hates them). Next time I will add something to add a little zest.

I'll definitely make it again my family devoured it! Next time I'll put a little more mayo, it was a little dry for me and a little more ranch mix. But like I said, my family LOVED it so maybe it was just me ;0
Great Flavor and definitely will make again.

This recipe definitely needs extra garlic powder, I added garlic salt and a little sea salt. I used 1 packet of ranch dressing and really think it would have been better with 1 1/2 packets. I did add my bacon right before serving so it wouldn't be soggy as other reviews indicated and I added more milk since it became a little dry after refrigerating overnight. Good taste overall!
My family loves this pasta dish!
Made this for a food table at a wrestling tournament and everyone went crazy. Substituted the fresh cooked bacon with fresh precooked bacon bits and it was amazing!! Definitely making this one again.
Love this as a side dish. I substitute the olives for peas.
I will make this again new favorite !!!!!

We loved this salad! It's easy to make and perfect for potlucks. We varied it a little by using liquid ranch dressing and freshly ground pepper. it's also easy to double the recipe if you're cooking for a crowd.

Everyone loved this. They even asked for the recipe! I used bacon bits and cherry tomatoes (quartered). I did 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon of pepper since I didn't have garlic pepper on hand. I made this the night before our get together so I mixed in a little milk before serving to get it a little creamer since it sets a little when made the day before.
This was easy to make and delicious!
Everyone loved this! Even the kids! It reminds me of a BLT like flavor. Its very good
this is always a hit :)

I would make it again, but I would separate the recipe into two bowls and only put olives in one of them. :-) I don't like olives but used them anyway. I found that were others who did not eat it based on the olives or picked them out. However, there were also many that loved them so I'd rather appeal to both groups and split the output. My wife loved it and had it for lunch twice. I did modify the tomatoes to using whole grape tomatoes as the original author suggested after modifying it herself. I agree that made it hold up a lot better.
This is really good pasta salad! Super easy to make! I used less olives than it calls for but everything else stayed the same.

I did not have olives in the pantry and added diced red onion. So easy to make. Creamy dressing, crunchy bacon and red onion. Very delicious. My family loved it. This dish is perfect to take to a potluck. Thanks for the recipe.
Good. I'll probably make it again. My family loves pasta and I try to have a variety. It seemed a little lacking in veggies, so I added a little minced onion and chopped green pepper.
Delish! I added chopped green pepper and green onions!
Summer staple. Perfect!

The directions said add more milk if it seemed dry after chilling in the refrigerator. I added some milk but it became soupy. Next time I would mix some mayonnaise with a little milk, stir to combine and then add to the pasta so it is not so soupy
Wonderful flavor using the ingredients just as they are listed in the recipe. This will be my new go to dish for family gatherings.
I added peeled cucumber, and red pepper, as well as additional mayo, ranch, pepper, and garlic powder. Once added this salad tasted great and will now be my go to pasta salad!
My family loved this dish! Making it again this week.
i made it excactly how the recipe said to i thought about putting red onion in it or cucumber and i used tri color pasta also im gonna put some red onion in it and i didnt use any milk
It turned out great!!!!

DE-LISH! My 4yo likes it too! I boiled about 1/3 bag frozen peas and carrots with bowtie pasta, used a whole cup milk(perfect amount of sauce), added broccoli instead of olives and used red onion which is what I had on hand. Soooooo good! Next time I'll add carrot and sunflower seeds and also try a version with egg!
I really enjoyed this salad. I took it to a party and everyone really liked it. I made it the night before as recommended and the flavors were well combined.
doubled sauce, 2 cups cheese, added 1 can of pees, 1 full pound of bacon,really good
Very good.!! I added a dash of crushed red pepper flakes! I will make this for an upcoming baby shower.
Great for these hot summer days. Neighbors enjoyed also.
Good recipe. Great for picnic or dish to pass.
So easy to make and so flavorful! I will definitely make this again!
